subject: Science
title: How Fish Breathe Underwater
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Fish Breathe Underwater.

hook.text: Fish don't hold their breath. They extract oxygen dissolved in water.

buildup.text: Water flows over their gills â€” thin membranes packed with tiny blood vessels.

discovery.text: Oxygen passes from water into blood. COâ‚‚ passes from blood into water.

twist.text: Fish gills are so efficient they extract 80% of dissolved oxygen. Our lungs extract only 25% from air.

climax.text: As oceans warm, they hold less dissolved oxygen â€” suffocating marine life in 'dead zones.'

punchline.text: Fish breathe better than we do. But warming seas are stealing their oxygen.

quiz.question: Why do warmer oceans threaten fish survival?
options: Warm water holds less dissolved oxygen
